intro: Octomeria flaviflora, commonly known as the golden-flowered octomeria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are ovate and hairy, while its stems are woody and often branched. Octomeria flaviflora is typically found in moist, shaded environments within tropical and subtropical regions.
